meico.mei

Class Mei

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.xml.XmlBase
      • meico.mei.Mei

  • public class Mei
extends XmlBase
    This class holds the mei data from a source file in a XOM Document.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class meico.xml.XmlBase

        data, file, isValid

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int addIds()
      this method adds ids to note, rest, ... and chord elements in mei, as far as they do not have an id
      int computeMinimalPPQ()
      this function can be used by the application to determine the minimal time resolution (pulses per quarternote) required to represent the shortest note value (found in mei, can go down to 2048) in midi; tuplets are not considered
      java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm()
      converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv; the thime resolution (pulses per quarter note) is 720 by default or more if required (for very short note durations)
      java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm(int ppq)
      converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv, ppq (pulses per quarter) sets the time resolution
      java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm(int ppq, boolean dontUseChannel10)
      converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv, ppq (pulses per quarter) sets the time resolution
      java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm(int ppq, boolean dontUseChannel10, boolean ignoreExpansions)
      converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv, ppq (pulses per quarter) sets the time resolution
      java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm(int ppq, boolean dontUseChannel10, boolean ignoreExpansions, boolean cleanup)
      converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv, ppq (pulses per quarter) sets the time resolution
      KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm()
      converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
      KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm(int ppq)
      converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
      KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm(int ppq, boolean dontUseChannel10)
      converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
      KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm(int ppq, boolean dontUseChannel10, boolean ignoreExpansions)
      converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
      KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm(int ppq, boolean dontUseChannel10, boolean ignoreExpansions, boolean cleanup)
      converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
      java.util.List<MusicXml> exportMusicXml()
      converts the MEI data to MusicXML and returns a list of MusicXml objects, one per movement/mdiv; MEI expansions are resolved
      java.util.List<MusicXml> exportMusicXml(boolean ignoreExpansions)
      converts the MEI data to MusicXML and returns a list of MusicXml objects, one per movement/mdiv

      convert MEI to SVG
      SvgCollection exportSvg(boolean useOnlineVerovio, boolean oneLineScore)
      convert MEI to SVG TODO: so far, this is just a placeholder, cannot evaluate Verovio in the Nashorn engine, same problem as in MusicXml.exportMei()
      java.util.ArrayList<nu.xom.Element> getAllMdivs()
      Retrieve all mdiv elements from this MEI's music environment.

      Recursively retrieve mdiv elements.

      Retrieve all cariant encodings, i.e. all app and choice elements, in this MEI.

      Retrieve all variant encodings, i.e. all app and choice elements, in the subtree of the specified element.
      protected static nu.xom.Element getLayer(nu.xom.Element ofThis)
      returns the layer element in the mei tree of ofThis
      protected static java.lang.String getLayerId(nu.xom.Element layer)
      returns the def or n attribute value of an mei layer element or empty string if it is no layer or both attributes are missing
      nu.xom.Element getMeiHead() 
      nu.xom.Element getMusic() 
      protected static nu.xom.Element getStaff(nu.xom.Element ofThis)
      returns the staff element in the mei tree of ofThis
      protected static java.lang.String getStaffId(nu.xom.Element staff)
      returns the def or n attribute value of an mei staff element or empty string if it is no staff or both attributes are missing
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      This getter method returns the title string from either fileDesc or workDesc.
      protected void removeRendElements()
      rend elements are additional and totally optional visual information that introduce additional processing effort to mei to msm conversion; the only relevant information are its contents; this method replaces all rends by their contents
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> resolveCopyofs()
      the slacker attribute copyof may occur in the mei document and needs to be resolved before starting the conversion; this method replaces elements with the copyof attribute by deep copies of the referred elements; it may also be used to expand an mei document and free it from copyofs; this method does also include the processing of attribute sameas, which is similar to copyof; xml:id attributes get updated to prevent duplicates; elements that reference a copied element (e.g. by attributes startid and endid) receive a treatment as well
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> resolveCopyofsAndSameas()
      this method resolves all occurrences of attributes copyof and sameas
      void resolveExpansions()
      Expansion elements in MEI indicate the sequence in which sibling section and ending elements have to be arranged.
      private nu.xom.Element resolveExpansions(nu.xom.Element root)
      Expansion elements in MEI indicate the sequence in which sibling section and ending elements have to be arranged.
      boolean writeMei()
      writes the mei document to a ...
      boolean writeMei(java.lang.String filename)
      writes the mei document to a file (filename should include the path and the extension .mei); this method is mainly relevant for debug output after calling exportMsm()

    • Method Detail

      • writeMei

        public boolean writeMei()
        writes the mei document to a ...-meico.mei file at the same location as the original mei file; this method is mainly relevant for debug output after calling exportMsm()
        Returns:
        true if success, false if an error occured

      • writeMei

        public boolean writeMei(java.lang.String filename)
        writes the mei document to a file (filename should include the path and the extension .mei); this method is mainly relevant for debug output after calling exportMsm()
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename string including the complete path!
        Returns:
        true if success, false if an error occured

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        This getter method returns the title string from either fileDesc or workDesc. If none is given, it returns the filename. If not given either, "" is returned.
        Returns:

        Returns:
        the music element or null if this instance is not valid

      • getAllMdivs

        public java.util.ArrayList<nu.xom.Element> getAllMdivs()
        Retrieve all mdiv elements from this MEI's music environment. In case of nested mdivs, only the leaf mdivs are returned.
        Returns:
        a list of mdiv elements; can be empty

      • getAllMdivs

        private java.util.ArrayList<nu.xom.Element> getAllMdivs(nu.xom.Element inThis)
        Recursively retrieve mdiv elements. In case of nested mdivs, only the leaf mdivs are returned.
        Parameters:
        inThis - search them in this subtree
        Returns:

        public SvgCollection exportSvg(boolean useOnlineVerovio,
                               boolean oneLineScore)
        convert MEI to SVG TODO: so far, this is just a placeholder, cannot evaluate Verovio in the Nashorn engine, same problem as in MusicXml.exportMei()
        Parameters:
        useOnlineVerovio -
        oneLineScore -
        Returns:
        a collection of SVGs; it can be empty if the conversion fails

      • exportMsm

        public java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm()
        converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv; the thime resolution (pulses per quarter note) is 720 by default or more if required (for very short note durations)
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsm

        public java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm(int ppq)
        converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv, ppq (pulses per quarter) sets the time resolution
        Parameters:
        ppq - the ppq resolution for the conversion; this is counterchecked with the minimal required resolution to capture the shortest duration in the mei data; if a higher resolution is necessary, this input parameter is overridden
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsm

        public java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm(int ppq,
                                     boolean dontUseChannel10)
        converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv, ppq (pulses per quarter) sets the time resolution
        Parameters:
        ppq - the ppq resolution for the conversion; this is counterchecked with the minimal required resolution to capture the shortest duration in the mei data; if a higher resolution is necessary, this input parameter is overridden
        dontUseChannel10 - the flag says whether channel 10 (midi drum channel) shall be used or not; it is already dont here, at the mei2msm conversion, because the msm should align with the midi file later on
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsm

        public java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm(int ppq,
                                     boolean dontUseChannel10,
                                     boolean ignoreExpansions)
        converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv, ppq (pulses per quarter) sets the time resolution
        Parameters:
        ppq - the ppq resolution for the conversion; this is counterchecked with the minimal required resolution to capture the shortest duration in the mei data; if a higher resolution is necessary, this input parameter is overridden
        dontUseChannel10 - the flag says whether channel 10 (midi drum channel) shall be used or not; it is already dont here, at the mei2msm conversion, because the msm should align with the midi file later on
        ignoreExpansions - set this true to have a 1:1 conversion of MEI to MSM without the rearrangement that MEI's expansion elements produce
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsm

        public java.util.List<Msm> exportMsm(int ppq,
                                     boolean dontUseChannel10,
                                     boolean ignoreExpansions,
                                     boolean cleanup)
        converts the mei data into msm format and returns a list of Msm instances, one per movement/mdiv, ppq (pulses per quarter) sets the time resolution
        Parameters:
        ppq - the ppq resolution for the conversion; this is counterchecked with the minimal required resolution to capture the shortest duration in the mei data; if a higher resolution is necessary, this input parameter is overridden
        dontUseChannel10 - the flag says whether channel 10 (midi drum channel) shall be used or not; it is already dont here, at the mei2msm conversion, because the msm should align with the midi file later on
        cleanup - set true to return a clean msm file or false to keep all the crap from the conversion
        ignoreExpansions - set this true to have a 1:1 conversion of MEI to MSM without the rearrangement that MEI's expansion elements produce
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsmMpm

        public KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm()
        converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsmMpm

        public KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm(int ppq)
        converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
        Parameters:
        ppq - the ppq resolution for the conversion; this is counterchecked with the minimal required resolution to capture the shortest duration in the mei data; if a higher resolution is necessary, this input parameter is overridden
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsmMpm

        public KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm(int ppq,
                                                                      boolean dontUseChannel10)
        converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
        Parameters:
        ppq - the ppq resolution for the conversion; this is counterchecked with the minimal required resolution to capture the shortest duration in the mei data; if a higher resolution is necessary, this input parameter is overridden
        dontUseChannel10 - the flag says whether channel 10 (midi drum channel) shall be used or not; it is already done here, at the mei2msm conversion, because the msm should align with the midi file later on
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsmMpm

        public KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm(int ppq,
                                                                      boolean dontUseChannel10,
                                                                      boolean ignoreExpansions)
        converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
        Parameters:
        ppq - the ppq resolution for the conversion; this is counterchecked with the minimal required resolution to capture the shortest duration in the mei data; if a higher resolution is necessary, this input parameter is overridden
        dontUseChannel10 - the flag says whether channel 10 (midi drum channel) shall be used or not; it is already done here, at the mei2msm conversion, because the msm should align with the midi file later on
        ignoreExpansions - set this true to have a 1:1 conversion of MEI to MSM without the rearrangement that MEI's expansion elements produce
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMsmMpm

        public KeyValue<java.util.List<Msm>,java.util.List<Mpm>> exportMsmMpm(int ppq,
                                                                      boolean dontUseChannel10,
                                                                      boolean ignoreExpansions,
                                                                      boolean cleanup)
        converts the mei data into msm and mpm format and returns a tuplet of lists, one with the msms (one per movement/mdiv), the other with the corresponding mpms
        Parameters:
        ppq - the ppq resolution for the conversion; this is counterchecked with the minimal required resolution to capture the shortest duration in the mei data; if a higher resolution is necessary, this input parameter is overridden
        dontUseChannel10 - the flag says whether channel 10 (midi drum channel) shall be used or not; it is already done here, at the mei2msm conversion, because the msm should align with the midi file later on
        ignoreExpansions - set this true to have a 1:1 conversion of MEI to MSM without the rearrangement that MEI's expansion elements produce
        cleanup - set true to return a clean msm file or false to keep all the crap from the conversion
        Returns:
        the list of msm documents (movements) created

      • exportMusicXml

        public java.util.List<MusicXml> exportMusicXml()
        converts the MEI data to MusicXML and returns a list of MusicXml objects, one per movement/mdiv; MEI expansions are resolved
        Returns:

      • exportMusicXml

        public java.util.List<MusicXml> exportMusicXml(boolean ignoreExpansions)
        converts the MEI data to MusicXML and returns a list of MusicXml objects, one per movement/mdiv
        Parameters:
        ignoreExpansions - set this true to have a 1:1 conversion of MEI to MusicXML without the rearrangement that MEI's expansion elements produce
        Returns:

      • computeMinimalPPQ

        public int computeMinimalPPQ()
        this function can be used by the application to determine the minimal time resolution (pulses per quarternote) required to represent the shortest note value (found in mei, can go down to 2048) in midi; tuplets are not considered
        Returns:
        the minimal required time resolution to represent the shortest duration in this mei

      • resolveCopyofs

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> resolveCopyofs()
        the slacker attribute copyof may occur in the mei document and needs to be resolved before starting the conversion; this method replaces elements with the copyof attribute by deep copies of the referred elements; it may also be used to expand an mei document and free it from copyofs; this method does also include the processing of attribute sameas, which is similar to copyof; xml:id attributes get updated to prevent duplicates; elements that reference a copied element (e.g. by attributes startid and endid) receive a treatment as well
        Returns:
        null (no document loaded), an ArrayList with those ids that could not be resolved, or an empty ArrayList if everything went well

      • resolveCopyofsAndSameas

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> resolveCopyofsAndSameas()
        this method resolves all occurrences of attributes copyof and sameas
        Returns:

      • removeRendElements

        protected void removeRendElements()
        rend elements are additional and totally optional visual information that introduce additional processing effort to mei to msm conversion; the only relevant information are its contents; this method replaces all rends by their contents

      • resolveExpansions

        public void resolveExpansions()
        Expansion elements in MEI indicate the sequence in which sibling section and ending elements have to be arranged. This method creates a regularized, i.e. "through-composed", MEI that renders the expansions.

      • resolveExpansions

        private nu.xom.Element resolveExpansions(nu.xom.Element root)
        Expansion elements in MEI indicate the sequence in which sibling section and ending elements have to be arranged. This method creates a regularized, i.e. "through-composed", MEI that renders the expansions. The MEI tree is scanned recursively and expansions are resolved.
        Parameters:
        root - from this element on the whole subtree will be resolved
        Returns:
        the regularized version root (can be used to replace root)

      • addIds

        public int addIds()
        this method adds ids to note, rest, ... and chord elements in mei, as far as they do not have an id
        Returns:
        the generated ids count

      • getLayer

        protected static nu.xom.Element getLayer(nu.xom.Element ofThis)
        returns the layer element in the mei tree of ofThis
        Parameters:
        ofThis -
        Returns:
        the layer element or null if ofThis is not in a layer

      • getLayerId

        protected static java.lang.String getLayerId(nu.xom.Element layer)
        returns the def or n attribute value of an mei layer element or empty string if it is no layer or both attributes are missing
        Parameters:
        layer -
        Returns:
        def, n or empty string

      • getStaff

        protected static nu.xom.Element getStaff(nu.xom.Element ofThis)
        returns the staff element in the mei tree of ofThis
        Parameters:
        ofThis -
        Returns:
        the staff element or null if ofThis is not in a staff

      • getStaffId

        protected static java.lang.String getStaffId(nu.xom.Element staff)
        returns the def or n attribute value of an mei staff element or empty string if it is no staff or both attributes are missing
        Parameters:
        staff -
        Returns:
        def, n or empty string
